messageBody:
Hi Chris,
Thank you for the reply. Below is an outline of the framework that
we have which we are trying to migrate to JUNIT

example in a suite, a test case is like this

public void testLogin{

method1();
method2();
method3();
// if assert is used here in this test case it will work fine
}


The above methods have lot of other calls to otehr methods and I
have to use assertions in those methods also. Right now we are jsut
handling exceptions in our way and throwing them so that our
framework captures. Out framework with respect to test suites/cases
is almost similar to JUNIT. If i can get a way how the assertions
can be used in these other method calls which are being made from
the testXXX() methods i will be successful in migrating to JUNIT.

Please suggest if there is any alternative/solution. Thanks in
advance.
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Chris Dollin <chris.dollin@...> wrote:
>
> On Friday 22 June 2007 02:35, sireesha wrote:
>
> > how can we use assertions outside a junit testcase and still
make the
> > test case handle it.
>
> I don't understand what you're trying to do.
>
> A [junit] assertion, when it fails, throws a suitable exception.
The
> test case framework catches the exception and records it. The test
> case itself doesn't handle assertion exceptions.
>
> Show us a concrete example.
